questions.question: In Saussure’s model of semiotics, what are the two parts that make up a sign?
Which type of sign has a direct causal link to what it represents:
The word “rose” meaning “a type of flower” is an example of:
When text is used to “fix” the meaning of an image (e.g., a headline under a photo), Barthes calls this:
Which of the following best describes polysemy?
options: A sign that has only one meaning
The study of myths in media
The ability of signs to carry multiple meanings
The use of arbitrary symbols in design
The literal description of an image
questions.correctAnswer: The ability of signs to carry multiple meanings

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a symbol?
Codes and conventions help viewers interpret visuals because:
options: They create shared expectations and reduce ambiguity
They remove all possibility of polysemy
questions.correctAnswer: They create shared expectations and reduce ambiguity

questions.question: Cognitive dissonance in visual communication occurs when:
options: An image has both denotation and connotation

questions.question: Which ad campaign failed because it trivialized social justice protests by using a soda as a symbol of unity?
According to Barthes, “myth” in advertising refers to:
options: The literal meaning of an image
A false story created by brands
Cultural narratives that feel natural but are constructed
Text added to images for clarity
questions.correctAnswer: Cultural narratives that feel natural but are constructed
